timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from apache/master

Update

timeline.bodyText:
This should specify a value.
When used via TextIndexLuceneAssembler, it will be set to a default of 1024. jena-text may be used from code , no assembler, and then the default is zero from this line.
It is always passed in BasicQueryFactory(this.maxBasicQueries) by TextLuceneIndex so the other choice is set to -1 (an "unset" marker) and call BasicQueryFactory() when not set so that it tracks the Lucene choice for the default which may evolve over time.
timeline.author: afs

replies.bodyText: I think L#136, below, ensures a value for maxBasicQueries. Perhaps L#30 above in TextIndexConfig.java should be set to 1024 since that's the default in org.apache.lucene.queryparser.surround.query. BasicQueryFactory
replies.author: xristy

replies.bodyText:
Yours is a better explanation. I hadn't made the extra step to TextIndexConfig.
It gets a default from TextIndexConfig which itself may not have a default other than Java's 0. Only a call of setMaxBasicQueries sets it and that only comes from the assembler
Conclusion - it needs an explicit default (both places) so we can understand it ! :-)
Plan: Let this sit for at least 24 hours then merge it and make the changes. This has been here so long that I'm happy to do the changes directly. We've kept @DamienFontaine's PR waiting.
OK @xristy ? If that is fine with you, would you approve please?
replies.author: afs

replies.bodyText: Fine w/ me. I would vote for 1024 rather than -1 for the default. I approved changes on my request for changes.
replies.author: xristy

timeline.bodyText:
All the code looks good to me. Only one question here. The message says that it must be an int. But up to this point, I think we only know it's a) not null, and b) not a literal.
My RDF-Fu is a bit rusty, feel free to ignore if what I'm saying is completely wrong please. But I think it could be another type (char, bool, etc)? So I think only after this if, when we call getInt() we will actually know whether we have an int or not?
timeline.author: kinow

replies.bodyText:
Good point - this gives a basic warning for the first method call in maxBasicQueries = mbqNode.asLiteral().getInt()
getInt also parses xsd:String as a 32-bit integer (all the get do similar)
Having both the isLiteral test and the try-catch means better error messages.
The whole block could be wrapped in a try-catch for robustness. I'll add it in the post-merge work.
